SENT.plain: Anti-beta2-glycoprotein I antibodies are considered as a specific marker for the antiphospholipid syndrome
In contrast to lupus circulating anticoagulant and anticardiolipin (aCL) antibodies, they are usually not found at significant levels in infections
We report a case of pulmonary embolism in an adult with varicella
Transient significant levels of aCL antibodies and of IgM anti-beta2-GPI antibodies were observed
No other prothrombotic factor, including free protein S antigen deficiency, was found
The direct pathogenic role of these transient antibodies on the thrombotic event may then be suspected
They are probably associated with VZV acute infection and are absent two months after varicella
